This is the #1 JUnit FAQ -- same root problem as the LinkageError problem
with XML classes.

Check the archive of this list.  Or the FAQ on the Web site.  Problem with
checking the archives at this point is that the last 50 messages related to
the problem probably all say "check the archive."

Here's the answer (from memory, so you might want to double-check): 

- update excluded.properties in the junit.jar file to include org.w3c.dom.*
and org.xml.sax.*

- you can also get around it by using only the textui TextRunner in JUnit,
or using the JUnitTestRunner in Ant.

- a bug has been entered, and when JUnit 3.8 or whatever is released, this
will be fixed.

Scott Stirling
JRun QA
Macromedia

-----Original Message-----
From: nthali
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 12/8/01 3:41 PM
Subject: [junit] trouble with JUnit and XML

We are not able to run any JUnit tests for any of our classes that
use XML. We get a "java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError". Using
a main() method within that class seems to run the methods being
tested just fine.
Has anyone else encountered anything similar ? 
I am adding some test source code and xml file for anyone that
might want to run this. 
Any help would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks,
Nilesh
